image.altText: A woman in a floral dress in the sun.

props.synopsis: Women, the elderly and other vulnerable residents in Alice Springs say they feel increasingly unsafe after a string of violent incidents, and are taking steps to protect themselves.

title.children: Women, vulnerable residents act to protect themselves amid Alice Springs crime

image.altText: Toronto NSW

props.synopsis: An oppressive heatwave stretching from Darwin to Victoria will send temperatures soaring up to 15 degrees Celsius above average during the coming days.

title.children: Hottest summer weather in five years predicted for coming days

image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: A list of seven requests has been issued to the Commonwealth by NT Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro to tackle recent violent crime in Alice Springs. It includes a call for Centrelink payments to be distributed on days when takeaway alcohol sales are banned in the outback town.

title.children: NT chief minister calls for welfare payment changes in Alice Springs

image.altText: An artisan makes traditional West Javanese puppets called wayang

props.synopsis: An elite school will soon ditch a long-running language program, in a move experts say could be "ideological" and will leave Australia ill-equipped to engage with our closest Asian neighbour.

title.children: Elite NT school drops key Asian language in 'huge backwards step'

image.altText: Police walking in the Alice Springs CBD.

props.synopsis: As the chief minister and police commissioner fly into Alice Springs amid a rise in violent crime, locals say there's been a breakdown in law and order "at a level that we haven't seen before".

title.children: 'The government has lost control': Alice locals vent anger over crime

image.altText: Woman speaks at press conference in front of police officer

props.synopsis: The NT chief minister and police commissioner have flagged federal support may be called upon for Alice Springs, in response to what they describe as "serious, heinous, and escalating violence" in the town.

title.children: Chief flags possible federal support to address Alice Springs crime

image.altText: Close up of Central Land Council chair looking into camera, standing in sun and wearing a CLC cap and sunnies

props.synopsis: Aboriginal land councils and the Northern Territory's anti-discrimination commissioner are the latest to join calls for an independent review into racism in the NT Police Force.

title.children: Calls strengthen in NT for independent police racism review

image.altText: Grant Keetley receives a medal

props.synopsis: As Cyclone Tracy's ferocious winds lashed Darwin, St John Ambulance volunteers answered the calls for help, setting the stage for 50 years of service to the Northern Territory.

title.children: How Cyclone Tracy saw the birth of St John Ambulance NT

image.altText: India bowler Mohammed Siraj stares down Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne.

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne and Mohammed Siraj come face to face to play with the stumps just moments before Labuschagne nicks off to leave Australia three wickets down at lunch on day two of the Gabba Test. Follow live.

title.children: Marnus Labuschagne falls after bizarre bails confrontation with Indian quick

image.altText: A man in a black blazer with wire frame glasses sits

props.synopsis: Isak Andic, 71, was hiking with relatives when he fell 100 metres from a cliff near Barcelona, police said.

title.children: Founder of Spanish fashion brand Mango dies after 100m cliff fall

image.altText: A stern looking Donald Trump waves as he walks onto city street

props.synopsis: US network ABC News will pay $US15 million ($23 million) towards Trump's presidential library to settle a lawsuit over an inaccurate on-air assertion about the president-elect's civil case with E Jean Carroll.

title.children: US network agrees to $23 million settlement in Trump defamation lawsuit

image.altText: Climate protest 4

props.synopsis: A new study shows more than 20 per cent of climate and environment protests in Australia lead to arrests, more than in the UK, Norway, and the United States.

title.children: Australia leads the world in arresting climate and environment protesters

image.altText: Rupert Murdoch looks directly at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch wanted to give son Lachlan future control over his empire by stripping power from his other children. But a court rejected his plan.

title.children: A court ruling has blown up Rupert Murdoch's succession plan

props.synopsis: ABC Middle East correspondent Eric Tlozek goes inside Syria's most infamous prison as rescuers dig for hidden cells in search of more survivors.

title.children: The ABC takes a look inside Syria's notorious Sednaya prison

image.altText: Two men wearing black clothes and big gold chains look sideways, one has a concerned expression

props.synopsis: A woman who accused rappers Jay-Z and Sean "Diddy" Combs of sexually assaulting her when she was 13 at an awards show after-party acknowledges certain inconsistencies in her story.

title.children: Woman accusing Jay-Z, Diddy of sexual assault acknowledges inconsistencies

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses looking down at her notes behind a lectern with two microphones.

props.synopsis: With the new Reserve Bank line-up to be announced as soon as tomorrow, Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor warns the opposition will consider any change to its membership an attempt to influence decisions on whether to cut or hike interest rates.

title.children: RBA board reshuffle would politicise interest rates, warns shadow treasurer

image.altText: A young white woman who is blind holding a large straw hat

props.synopsis: Next time you're scrolling for bargains online, consider the half a million Australians who don't find shopping on the web fun or simple, writes Nas Campanella.

title.children: 'Like you don't really matter': Why half a million Aussies struggle with online shopping

image.altText: A graphic of a woman at a mine between two trucks

props.synopsis: Appalling sexual harassment allegations and a damning report. The industries differ, but the stories are familiar, writes Lexy Hamilton-Smith.

title.children: From the casting couch to outback mines, sexual abuse stories have a familiar echo

image.altText: Former deputy premier Troy Grant, former siege hostage Louisa Hope and former police officer Ben Besant together cafe behind

props.synopsis: It is 10 years today since a lone-wolf gunman walked into the Lindt Cafe and took 18 people hostage, demanding politicians declare Australia was under attack from Islamic State.

title.children: 'It's always with you': The day terror came to the heart of Sydney

image.altText: Two sitting figures are seen in silhouette against the ocean and last light of the setting sun.

props.synopsis: Australians on the front line of climate change are fighting to save their vanishing ancestral home. Can a landmark lawsuit against the federal government save their way of life?

title.children: Life on a sinking island on Australia's northern fringe

image.altText: A man wedged between two woman, all wearing sunglasses while smiling at the camera by the beach

props.synopsis: Kerryn Draper was among hundreds of Australians stranded in Bali after a recent volcanic eruption. She returned with a cautionary tale about the financial and mental pressure of not being able to get home.

title.children: How a long-awaited dream trip to Bali quickly turned sour

image.altText: Men with pixilated features look at the camera, inside a factory.

props.synopsis: Migrant workers allege exploitation by Kawaguchi Manufacturing, accusing the supplier for Sony, Panasonic and Daikin of not paying wages and withholding passports.

title.children: 'Extremely irresponsible': Sony, Panasonic criticised for exiting amid worker exploitation

image.altText: Yoon Suk Yeol stands behind a podium, speaking into a microphone, with two flags behind him

props.synopsis: South Korea's president Yoon Suk Yeol has been impeached in a historic vote, marking the end of a tremulous week since his desperate attempt to impose martial law spectacularly failed.

title.children: The rise and fall of Yoon Suk Yeol — South Korea's impeached president

image.altText: Two children sit in a red auto rickshaw

props.synopsis: At one of the busiest border crossings in Lebanon, Syrians are bundling up their belongings and preparing for the journey home after the ousting of the Assad regime.

title.children: Syrians line up at the border after years in Lebanon, returning home

image.altText: The back view of a woman with long hair, outside, with pink and green shadows and light around her.

props.synopsis: A leading psychologist says the case involving a woman with dissociative identity disorder gained worldwide attention from those who study and live with multiple personalities.

title.children: 'Relief' as court shows 'compassion' to witness with multiple personalities

image.altText: Wolverhampton Wanderers' Rayan Ait-Nouri clashes with Ipswich Town's Wes Burns.

props.synopsis: Wolverhampton players and staff were involved in chaotic post-match scenes for the second straight Premier League game.

title.children: Wolves players involved in more post-match EPL chaos

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: OK, know-it-all … prove just how much you know in this week's Hard Quiz!

title.children: Think you know it all? Only the sharpest minds can ace this quiz!

image.altText: Surgeons operating in a hospital

props.synopsis: Health Minister Mary-Anne Thomas has welcomed an investigation into reports some surgeons were billing for procedures they had little or no involvement in.

title.children: Victorian anti-corruption watchdog probes fraudulent surgery claims

image.altText: A picture of a woman pulling off a black leather jacket

props.synopsis: Described as "a classic design" from the 1978 musical, the jacket had been expected to sell for around $US80,000 — $100,000.

title.children: Olivia Newton-John's Grease jacket fetches more than $740,000

image.altText: A picture of Vietnamese noodle salad sitting in a bowl.

props.synopsis: Alice Zaslavsky's light and refreshing salad is perfect for summer.

title.children: Vietnamese cold noodle salad with chicken and mango

image.altText: A black and white photo showing men in the 1920s, pushing an old car up a rugged hill.

props.synopsis: These days it's a popular and World Heritage-listed NSW destination. In 1924 though, it took an ambitious team to get the first car to the top.

title.children: It's a century since the first car reached the rugged Barrington Tops

image.altText: Josie Baff, wearing her snowboard helmet and goggles lifted above her eyes, looks on

props.synopsis: Australian snowboard cross speedsters Josie Baff and Cameron Bolton have kicked off their seasons with World Cup silver medals.

title.children: Baff and Bolton win World Cup snowboard silvers in Italy

image.altText: Alex Thomas, the referee issues instructions, by raising his arms, outstretched

props.synopsis: A match in England's second-tier rugby union league has been abandoned after the referee was knocked unconscious.

title.children: Rugby match abandoned after referee knocked out by football

image.altText: A wombat fitted with a tracking collar sitting in red dirt

props.synopsis: The habits of the northern hairy-nosed wombat have been a mystery until now, thanks to the animal equivalent of a fitness tracker.

title.children: Tracking collars uncover secrets of critically endangered Aussie icon
